channel.title: Simon Kapitza on Simon Kapitza
channel.description: Recent content in Simon Kapitza on Simon Kapitza

item.title: A predictive model of fractional land use
Predicting the ecological outcomes of global consumption
Downloading and merging WorldClim tiles
item.description:
I am regularly working with the WorldClim data set and in some cases had to download and merge the individual high res (0.5 arcmin) tiles for my work. To make things easier I made a little R package out of my workflow that does that really quickly and I will briefly discribe here with examples how it works. I’ve since also added support for 90m SRTM tiles that are also downloadable via the raster package, please refer to help files fore details.

Download the package from GitHub:

devtools::install_github("kapitzas/WorldClimTiles")

Load the package and download a boundary file for France. France is a good example because it intersects with two WorldClim tiles.

require("WorldClimTiles")
require("raster")

#Download polygon feature for France
fra <- getData("GADM", country = "FRA", level = 0)

Get the WorldClim tile names that are intersected by the boundary shape of France.

#Get WorldClim tile names 
tilenames <- tile_name(fra)
tilenames

Download the two tiles (“15”, “16”). The default download path is the current working directory.

#Download tiles
tiles <- tile_get(tilenames, "bio")

The downloaded tiles will look something like this if you plot them next to each other: Merge the downloaded tiles layer by layer. The function produces a raster stack that contains the merged layers with the correct variable names.

merged <- tile_merge(tiles)

Plotting the merged raster:

item.title: Links to publication guidelines
item.description:
I finally got around to starting a manuscript on my first PhD publication. Part of the reason why it’s been taking me so long to get started is because I’ve had zero orientation in the jungle of different submission formats and journals. Below the submission types of major ecology journals, including links to author guidelines (just click on the submission formats).

This list is definitely really not complete, so please let me know what I missed and I can keep adding to this.
Journal Submission formats Publisher
Advances in Ecological Research Elsevier
Austral Ecology World Limits, Original Articles, Review Articles Wiley
Avian Conservation and Ecology Research Paper, Letter, Forum, Essay, Invited Essay or Review, Short Communication, Methodology Scoiety of Canadian Ornithologists
Biological Conservation Research Papers, Review Article, Systematic Review, Perspectives, Short communications, Book Reviews, Letters to the Editor, Special Issue papers, Reviewer Commentary Elsevier
Biology Letters Research Articles, Opinion Pieces, Comments and Invited Replies, Reviews, Mini-Series, Special Features Wiley
Conservation Biology Contributed Papers, Resaerch Note, Review, Essay, Converation Methods, Comment, Diversity, Letter, Book Reviews Wiley
Diversity and Distributions Biodiversity Resaerch, Review, Conservation Biogeography Methods, Biodiversiions, Biodiversity Viewpoints, Biodiversity Letters Wiley
Ecography Original Research, Forum, Review & Synthesis, Software notes, News and Views, Brevia,  Wiley
Ecological Applications Articles, Communications, Invited Features, Forums, Letters to the Editor,  Wiley
Ecological Modelling Original Research Paper, Review Articles, Short Communications, Letters to the Editor, Book reivews, News and announcements, Viewpoint Elsevier
Ecological Monograph Original Research Paper, Review, Concepts and Synthesis Wiley
Ecology Letters Letters, Methods, Ideas and Perspecitves, Reivews and Syntheses, Technical Comments Wiley
Ecosystems Resaerch Article, Mini-Review, Special Feature, Editorial Springer
Evolution Original Articles, Brief Communications, Perpsectives, Digests, Technical Comments, Book Reviews, Commentaries Wiley
Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment Research Communications, Reviews, Concepts and Questions Wiley
Functional Ecology Review, Forum, Commentary, Perspectives, FE Spotlights Wiley
Global Change Biology Primary Resarch Article, Technical Advances, Resaerch Reivews, Opinions, Reports, Editiorials, Editorial Commentaries, Letters to the Editor, Resposne to the Editor Wilery
Global Ecology and Biogeography Research Paper, Ecological Sounding, Concept, Meta-analysis, Research review, Macroecological method, Data paper, Correspondence Wiley
Journal of Animal Ecology Standard paper, Review, How To paper, Synthesis paper, Commentary, Forum, In Focus Wiley
Journal of Applied Ecology Standard paper, Review, Commentary, Forum, Policy Direction, Practitioner’s Perspective Wiley
Journal of Biogeography Research Paper, Methods and Tools, data, Synthesis, Perspecitve, Commentary, Correspondence Wiley
Journal of Ecology Research Article, Essay review, Forum, Mini-reviews, Commentary, Biological Flora of the British Isles Wiley
Landscape Ecology Original Research, Short communications, Review article, Perspectives, Book reviews,  Springer
Methods in Evolution and Ecology Research Article, Review, Forum, Commentary, Application, Practical Tools Wiley
Nature Climate change Letters, Articles, Review Article, Perspective, News and Views, Correspondence, Commentary, Books & Arts, Features, News Features Springer
Nature Ecology & Evolution Article, Brief Communiction, Review, Perspective, News and Views, Correspondence, Comment, Books & Art, Features and News Features Springer
Nature ISME Journal Article, Review Article, Winogradsky Review, Brief Communication, Comment, Perspective Wiley
Oikos Research Papers, Forum, Meta-analysis Wiley
People and Nature Research Article, Review, Synthesis, Perspective, Debates and Conversations, Correspondence BES
Trends in Ecology and Evolution Review, Opinion, Letters, Science & Society articles, Spotlight, Book Review, Forum Elsevier
